attributes.action: Rethink the way in which employment and support allowance is examined
attributes.background: Employment support allowance medical assessments are only done once at 14 weeks - things can change medically so they need doing more than once - they are also not robust enough
attributes.additional_details: I have several disabilities and illnesses myself and have been placed in the work category yet I am unable to hold down a job

attributes.action: Create a law that babies born prison should live with other relatives
attributes.background: Babies who are born in prison can't help it and should be moved to other relatives or adopted.
attributes.additional_details: Actually what inspired me may sound really cheesy, but it was Aerosmith's cover of Give Peace A Chance, with Sierra Leone's all-star refugees saying we shouldn't punish the kids for what they never did. Just like whether someone is black, or white, or Asian or whatever, they can't help it. And neither are kids who are born in prisons. Adults who go to prison KNOW why they're there and it's because they've done wrong (90% of the time), so I'm calling on David Cameron to create a law which means babies born in UK prisons are immediately taken out to live with other relatives in a stable loving home, or if needs be, adopted/fostered.

attributes.action: Limit council tax exemption to students housed in purpose built accommodation.
attributes.background: When Coventry planning committee agree another student accommodation development they quote that this will return a good number of current "student houses" back to use as family homes. To encourage this only students in purpose built multiple occupation properties should be exempt from council tax.

attributes.action: Make competition in the water industry as we currently have for gas and electric
attributes.background: Competition in the gas and electricity market has been in force for over 15 years however the water industry remains an uncompetitive market whereby a consumer has no choice over who supplies their clean water and who deals with waste water.
attributes.additional_details: Gas and electricity is an open market allowing a consumer to switch supplier for cheaper rates relatively easy. No such thing is available for clean and waste water. Consumers are stuck with the supplier for their region and cannot influence the price they pay.

attributes.action: NHS doctors should not be allowed to charge fees for care home visits
attributes.background: NHS doctors should not be allowed charge extra fees for care home visits.Currently some practices are charging care homes circa £100,00 per year as a retainer.The elderly have, generally, paid into the national health service all of their lives and now in their old age are being penalised.

attributes.action: Plase let Second generations born outside the UK have British Citizenship.
attributes.background: Britain only lets first generations born outside the UK have citizenship. At least one more generation should be elegible like in other countries.
attributes.additional_details: Let a second generation be born outside the UK like when act 1981 was made for first generations by descent.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for children to be unloaded from a vehicle in to the roadway
attributes.background: On my way to work I often see parents unloading their toddlers and children on to the roadway. It would not take much for a child to end up being injured by a passing car. I think children should be unloaded on the kerbside for their own safety.

attributes.action: Make full home inspection surveys mandatory on purchases -'buyer beware' caveat
attributes.background: 4 in 5 home buyers do not bother with full structual surveys.  This can often lead to thousands in repairs and structural work which can put enormous strain on families.  A mandatory home survey system similar to Scotland home report is needed to protect buyers and save families misery of repairs.
attributes.additional_details: Not enough guidance is issued to buyers from banks and/or estate agents about the sheer importance of buying a property without a full survey. A law change is needed to make it mandatory that full structural surveys are conducted prior to purchases either from the buyer or similar to Scotland Home report; from the seller

attributes.action: Pay the unemployed to drive ambulances
attributes.background: just a gud idea
attributes.additional_details: it's a no-brainer

attributes.action: Prevent coffee from being sold to under 16 year olds
attributes.background:
A coffee shop served my 11 year old coffee without any adult being present. Apparently this is a done thing
Energy drinks have an age limit so therefore I feel something so high in caffeine should have the same restrictions.
Serving coffee to people so young without parents should not be allowed

attributes.action: Lower the age of sexual consent to 14 if both parties are under 16
attributes.background: I would like action on this petition because I feel that sexual consent laws are outdated. I feel as if sexual consent should be legal (if both under 16 and over 14)  like a "Romeo and Juliet" Law like they have in other countries. I think this would help teenagers feel better about sexual consent.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: No free bus passes,tv licences for people holding over 100k in account.
attributes.background: Not fair lot of millionaires in uk can afford it and they still get all these benefits.

attributes.action: Cap private renting to affordable prices for working families
attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: Make Slurry Tanks safer, an  alarm should sound & also inform authorities.
attributes.background: Slurry is a mixture of manure and water. Waste from animals are stored  during the winter when cattle are kept indoors, to be spread during the warmer months. It has to be broken up & mixed, to be spread. At the mixing stage the odourless & invisible gases are produced that can kill within seconds.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no such thing as a safe slurry tank. Gases are produced by bacteria during the decomposition of slurry, these can kill instantly. The gas settles in a cloud over the top of the slurry during mixing. 

It stays in these tanks maybe for a number of months and a lethal combination of gases build up, including methane, carbon dioxide, ammonia, and worst of all, probably, hydrogen sulphide.

attributes.action: Move Cannabis to Class C and move it from a schedule 1 drug
attributes.background: Both of the current class and scheduling of cannabis are out of date, unscientific, completely against all evidence, have created enormous harm to society and has held back medical advances for over 45 years.
attributes.additional_details: The reclassification of cannabis from Class C to Class B was done as part of a deal made by Gordon Brown and the Daily Mail editor. This was done against the findings, research and recommendation of the ACMD. The schedule 1 status means that the drug has no medical value. This is completely wrong as it was still being prescribed as a medicine in the UK until 1971. Over the last 20 years there have been on average 2 published studies per day on medical cannabis. People are suffering as a result.

attributes.action: Make panel van speed limits the same as cars.
attributes.background:
Speed limit for vans on an A road is 50mph - the same as a lorry.
This was set in 1982 when vans did not have disc brakes, ABS, etc.
An increase to 60mph would help with traffic flow and stop dangerous overtaking of vans.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to teach all kinds of religion in schools equally
attributes.background: Schools are currently teaching religious studies or religious education to our children which is heavily based on Christianity. If it was compulsory to teach all religions and cultures our kids would have more understanding and be more accepting to people with different beliefs reducing segregation.
attributes.additional_details: Recent political movements have lead to a 52 percent rise in race related reports. I believe this starts at home and in school. If we educate our children in school about every religion we can they will develops educated views and become more tolerant and accepting of others. This is so very important to our multi cultural society and progression as humans that we need to get this movement to change the way we teach.

attributes.action: Stop night time road closures which is costing haulage companies millions
attributes.background: Road closures during the night are costing lorry drivers millions in lost time and fuel. The diversions off of some motorways can add an hour on to a journey. It seems like the highways agency find it easier to close a road rather put a contaflow in place.

attributes.action: Stop parties from supplying 'helpful' questions to ask the PM.
attributes.background: The party in power circulates 'helpful' questions to ask the PM during PM's questions. The number of questions allowed to be asked is limited, therefore these 'helpful' questions are being asked instead of Mp's asking important constituency and national matters.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside the Commons 2015 Season 1 Episode 1 shows this point perfectly and the times stated below explains exactly what we need to stop to allow more important issues being brought up during PMQ's.

Yet another reason why the public feel so wary of politicians, they are constantly wasting time and squandering the chance to reply to real topics, purely for self-gratification.

40:33 - 43:55
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bnq2cY299xs

attributes.action: Make free healthcare at the point of service a human right
attributes.background: One of the pieces of legislation of the current government is introducing a British bill of rights. The purpose of this petition is for one of those rights to be the right to free healthcare at the point of use.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to protect the NHS and prevent the privatization of our health service.

attributes.action: Debate the rich poor divide, media bias and its effects on fear of immigration
attributes.background: We want parliament to move debates beyond the fear of migration and what to do about it. To the socio-economic background within which this fear is being nurtured and what to do about that. Including media coverage of the topic, tax avoidance-depriving the UK of revenue & the growing rich/ poor gap.
attributes.additional_details: Open and forward thinking discussion is urgently needed to re-dress the in balance of the economics of globalisation, money markets and the effects of private lobbying within Westminster by big business and private individuals. Trickle down is not working and wealth is pooling upwards instead. Leaving fewer resources for ever greater numbers of people world wide. I believe this is a root cause for the current fear of immigration in the UK which is being fuelled by facets of invested media.

attributes.action: We in uk deserves a tax threshold raise from 11k to 68k whatever the income.
attributes.background: We don't mind paying tax. Just don't tax us before the 68k income limit PA. Sign this people it will help everyone.

attributes.action: Increase the Council Tax band values for England to acceptable & relevant levels
attributes.background:
Council Tax valuations are based on the value of properties.

The value is the price the property would have sold for on the open market on 1 April 1991 in England and 1 April 2003 in Wales. Properties were put into a band based on their value on those dates.
attributes.additional_details:
Current Council Tax bands in England (1 April 1991 values)
Band / Value
A	up to £40,000 
B	£40,001 to £52,000
C	£52,001 to £68,000
D	£68,001 to £88,000
E	£88,001 to £120,000
F	£120,001 to £160,000
G	£160,001 to £320,000
H	more than £320,000

https://www.gov.uk

The bands were set in 1991 when house prices were 1/4 of today's value.  Anyone moving house today unfairly falls in to band F,G or H and pays between £2400-£3600 in Tax. The Values/Band should now be quadrupled in line with house prices.

attributes.action: make a new law to force landlords to allow pets in rented properties
attributes.background: all pets deserve a loving home and this is being taken away by landlords refusing to allow pets so I ask all animal lovers to support this and get the government to make a new law forcing landlords to allow pets in rented properties

attributes.action: Brexit talks by committee of 65, on the basis of proportional representation.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has now voted to leave the EU, to ensure that the negotiations are carried out with every person from every political background being represented I propose a committee carry out the talks based on a Proportional Representation distribution of seats from the last General election.
attributes.additional_details:
This is the biggest political event in our life times, no one party should be tarred with the negotiations of extracting the United Kingdom from the EU.
All parts of society need to feel 'United' in a common goal and see first hand that their voice is being heard.
The Scottish, Welsh, Irish, Labour, Conservatives, Lib dems, Greens, Ukip all represent the United Kingdom.... Let us Unite for the common good where no one is left behind unheard.

attributes.action: Reunite Britain with a reformed political system
attributes.background: It is clear that the country is divided. England, Scotland, Wales, N. Ireland and London are seemingly at odds with one another and the Westminster elite are not helping. Let's reform the political system to give a fairer, equal governance and voice to the people of the 'United' Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
How? 
1) Devolve more power and money away from Westminster and into the regions.
2) Introduce proportional representation so the electorate have a wider selection of candidates to choose from. Let's eradicate 'wasted' votes.
3) Controversially, introduce compulsory voting. This would force our education sector to be more politically aware and engaging with younger voters.
4) Make electronic voting available to further encourage accessibility.

attributes.action: Stop bonfires, during the hours of daylight, in residential areas.
attributes.background: I live in an area with large gardens but neighbours frequently have bonfires during daylight hours. Smoke never blows into their garden! Gardens should be enjoyed and relaxing but this is impossible with smoke making you choke. If they waited until after dark, then no-one would be affected by it.

attributes.action: To rule out membership of the E.E.A
attributes.background: Following the vote on the U.K.'s membership of the E.U. there is much discussion about the way forward. One option is membership of the E.E.A. given the express desire of the public, in voting to leave, is to establish sovereignty and control of our boarders this option is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Start a fund to help EU nationals obtain their permanent residence cards
attributes.background: This petition asks that the government considers starting a fund to help all EU nationals that wish to become British citizens pay for their permanent residence cards and associated lawyer’s fees, allowing them to further integrate with the UK before it leaves the EU.
attributes.additional_details: EU nationals that have migrated to the UK have a net positive contribution to the UK economy. These EU nationals now face having to obtain a permanent residence card to remain in the UK or obtain British citizenship, a requirement to vote on decisions affecting their future. Before November 12th 2015 there was no requirement for citizens of EU countries to obtain a permanent residence card. There is no guarantee that EU and EEA citizens will be able to remain without one. http://bit.ly/1RJEOMm

attributes.action:
New Bank Holiday.
The Epiphany should be a national bank holiday.
attributes.background: I always have to work the Epiphany and I feel that this is not correct. Whilst other cultures are allowed extra time off work to celebrate their beliefs, myself and many others are denied this opportunity. If it was a Bank Holiday, everybody could unite, join in and celebrate this event.
attributes.additional_details:
Epiphany is a public holiday in countries such as Austria, Colombia, Croatia, Cyprus, Poland, Ethiopia (but on different date that varies annually), parts of Germany, Greece, Italy, Slovakia, Spain, and Uruguay. 

http://www.timeanddate.com/holidays/common/epiphany

attributes.action: implement a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing (fracking) for 20 years
attributes.background: fracking is still in the early stages of development compared with other mining methods but seems to already be implicated in various environmental problems, a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing for a minimum of 20 years will give time to show the long term implications for the environment

attributes.action: Cyclists to display identification such as a number plate for accountability
attributes.background:
I believe because cyclists have anonymity some  ignore the Highway Code, creating a danger to themselves, other road users and pedestrians
I have witnessed numerous dangerous, reckless and ignorant actions
Identification and accountability could make the roads a safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce the risk cyclists present to themselves and others. Through accountability  to create a culture of best practice.
In an age of speed cameras and dashboard cams to make the cyclist identifiable when involved or causing incidents.
To promote greater harmony between the motorist and cyclist. To make the roads a safer place for pedestrians.

attributes.action: Discuss the establishment of a rival EU 'London based Global trading group'.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom's decision to leave the EU has created an ideal opportunity to create a separate trading group outside of and free of the influences of the EU. Based in London, the new trading group will operate in a new purpose built center, whose sole focus will be economy and trade.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's decision to leave the EU is a fantastic chance to create a truly global trading group. With the UK's strong links to her commonwealth countries(both former and present), the United States, China and Japan, the establishment of a new economic trading group based in London in new, purpose headquarters will undoubtedly attract existing members of the EU who are reluctant to leave. The strengths of the new Pan trading group, is the absence of politics and its location in a truly global city.

attributes.action: Ban the use of in game purchases for non-permanent downloads
attributes.background: The gaming industry is slowly being ruined by games that are paid, yet have objectives or objectives that are almost inachievable without paying more. We therefore call for legislation to ban these purchases for this virtual cash. By this we do not mean paid permanent addons or expansions.
attributes.additional_details: For example: You buy a game. You spend £40. Then you start playing and you pretty much get forced or pressured to buy 'virtual cash' to get certain things in the game that is free dlc but so overpriced in the games' currency that achievement of this is only possible through either excessive play to near extremes or take the easy route and pay your hard earned cash to 'quick buy' this. Not only is this discrimination to those who have less money but its ruining games and must therefore be banned.

attributes.action: Make it so petition makers can represent their issue and argument in parliament.
attributes.background: Are you tired of an issue being raised through a petition, only for it to be raised in parliament and the issue not solved. I feel that we should have a chance to voice our issues and make our argument heard, not only through writing, but as people and actually get a resolution to the problem.

attributes.action: Following EU exit vote make UK tax haven to maintain/entice economic investment.
attributes.background: There is a strong potential that foreign investment will be negatively impacted following the EU exit vote, with markets & currencies already slumping. I am suggesting the UK becomes a tax haven (with subsequent tax reform) to assist in maintaining & promoting foreign investment & economic growth.

attributes.action: Make the drink driving law more strict or introduce a zero tolerance policy.
attributes.background:
Every year, over 250 people are killed on UK roads and over 7,000 casualties from drink driving. In 2013, 683,651 roadside breath tests were carried out by the police, which 71,675 drivers
or riders failed or refused to take the test. Many of these are due to people driving the morning after.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned suggest that people refer to the horrific facts shown in the RoSPA July 2015 "Drinking and Driving" report to see that even just 1 accident, injury or even death is too many. A reform of the law should be considered to lower the limit or introduce a zero tolerance on the matter. Thus to save the lives of countless people horrifically torn away from their families in such awful circumstances.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to show a Nazi-style swastika tattoo.
attributes.background: Sporting a Nazi swastika tattoo is as much a hate crime as speaking such sentiments. They should be made illegal if they are visible and tattoo parlours should be punished under the law by fines and prison sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
Swastikas are illegal in Germany and should be illegal in the UK too.
Let us not forget the hundreds of thousands of people who lost their lives fighting Nazism in the last world war and people who think they are somehow being patriotic by having these symbols of hatred engraved in their skin are actually just spitting on their graves.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for neighbours to record you & your property with CCTV!
attributes.background:
Currently, there are no laws governing the use of domestic CCTV  which impacts the neighbouring resident's privacy. Neighbours are able to record you, your family & your property. LEGALLY

Your privacy can be taken away from you & placed in the hands of your neighbours! PROTECT YOUR PRIVACY!
attributes.additional_details:
My neighbour has recently installed CCTV which captures the whole of my garden. He now has 24/7 access to my whole garden and is able to sit and watch us from his smart phone whenever he wishes! 

We have asked him to move the cameras as we have children and would prefer that they are not recorded! He has refused and there is nothing we can about it but to create this petition in hopes that you will sign to help bring back our privacy. 

We need to protect ourselves and our families! PLEASE SIGN

attributes.action: The Government to establish the workings of Article 50 TEU before invocation.
attributes.background: Article 50 of the EU describes the method of how a country leaves the EU. There is insufficient information within the text of the article to properly understand how the mechanics of it would work. The government should seek answers to all outstanding questions prior to invocation.
attributes.additional_details: The biggest outstanding questions is whether or not an article 50 invocation can be withdrawn or not. Others are around the scope of what can be negotiated and what needs to be agreed before the conclusion of article 50. The Government should establish all outstanding questions from the public and seek answers from the EU before article 50 is ever invoked.

attributes.action: To let 13-17 year olds vote.
attributes.background: I think after the European referendum, people have now realisd the real consequence of the outcome but what people don't understand is that it will affect our children's futures. They should have the right to vote to protect their futures and decide what is right.

attributes.action: Parliament should defer their recess until Article 50 is instigated.
attributes.background: In the light of the major decisions facing this country and pressures from EU Members, require that Parliament defer their recess until the negotiations with the EU over the referendum result, MPs vote on accepting referendum and instigation of Article 50

attributes.action: Britain should apply to become the 51st state of the United States of America
attributes.background: In light of the result of the EU Referendum held on Thursday 23 June and the immediate concomitant decline in the UK economy, it would be germain to enter into a stronger economic union with the United States of America at the earliest possible opportunity.
attributes.additional_details: Under Article IV, Section 3, of the US Constitution, any territory may apply to Congress to join the United States. As the 51st US state, Great Britain would gain all the economic and military backing of the US federal government whilst also being free to draft its own state constitution and effectively retain its sovereignty. This would have the added advantage of allowing the UK Government to invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty sooner than October in order to re-stabilise the EU economy.

attributes.action: have a general election and a  referendum on the eu membership
attributes.background: as i don't believe people had the full facts of what they were doing and what would happen as the truth was not told

attributes.action: Make a hotel for refugees
attributes.background: It's so important to help with the refugee crisis that I decided to help, I want to help turn an old field or old building into a nice beautiful hotel for refugees coming from poor war torn countries.

attributes.action: Start talks on exiting the EU NOW
attributes.background:
The people have spoken and voted to leave the EU, David Cameron decided to quit, leaving nobody in charge. Labour MPs quitting, other MPs bickering and not listening to the people.
It's simple: we need to start the process to leave the EU NOW, not several months/years after this pointless nagging

attributes.action: Spend £250 million on our Healthcare
attributes.background: After the destructive Brexit our economy and currency have fallen and the promises made for our healthcare have been broken and now we need to spend £250 million pounds right!
attributes.additional_details: We hope this raises national attention as we want a better Britain and through this money being spend properly we can start straight away.

attributes.action: Reduce current state pensions to pay for any Brexit short fall in Gov' Finances
attributes.background: The majority of over 60's voted for Brexit, the financial impacts of which are to be born by younger generations (loss of access to single market, tightening job markets etc). If there is any financial short fall in Gov' finances due to Brexit it should be paid for by the baby boomers
